title: setting an array element with a sequence when explainer Exact
body:
Hi, I am trying to replicate this example: 

https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/notebooks/explainers/Exact.ipynb

```
import shap
import xgboost

X,y = shap.datasets.adult()
model = xgboost.XGBClassifier()
model.fit(X, y);
explainer = shap.explainers.Exact(model.predict_proba, X)
shap_values = explainer(X[:100])

```
Nonethless, the last step throws the following error: 

----> 1 shap_values = explainer(X[:100])

~/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/_exact.py in __call__(self, max_evals, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, silent, *args)
     65         return super(Exact, self).__call__(
     66             *args, max_evals=max_evals, main_effects=main_effects, error_bounds=error_bounds,
---> 67             batch_size=batch_size, silent=silent
     68         )
     69 

~/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/_explainer.py in __call__(self, max_evals, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, outputs, silent, *args, **kwargs)
    196             row_result = self.explain_row(
    197                 *row_args, max_evals=max_evals, main_effects=main_effects, error_bounds=error_bounds,
--> 198                 batch_size=batch_size, silent=silent, **kwargs
    199             )
    200             values.append(row_result.get("values", None))

~/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/_exact.py in explain_row(self, max_evals, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, silent, *row_args)
    111             row_values = np.zeros(len(fm))
    112             mask = np.zeros(len(fm), dtype=np.bool)
--> 113             _compute_grey_code_row_values(row_values, mask, inds, outputs, coeff, extended_delta_indexes, MaskedModel.delta_mask_noop_value)
    114 
    115 

**ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence.**
